summary: This modification replaces the male and female Nightingale Hood with a maskless one. Compatible with any texture replacers. Enjoy!
descriptionHtml:
[line]

[center][b][u][size=+2]Description[/size][/u][/b][/center]
[line]

[center]This modification allows the crafting/tempering of a maskless Nightingale Hood. Works with all male and female vanilla races. Compatible with any texture replacers. Enjoy![/center]

[line]

[center][b][u][size=+2]Installation[/size][/u][/b][/center]
[line]

[center]Extract the contents to your Skyrim/Data directory and enable esp or use Nexus Mod Manager.[/center]

[line]

[center][b][u][size=+2]Uninstallation[/size][/u][/b][/center]
[line]

[center]Delete all files from the Data folder that you extracted or use Nexus Mod Manager.[/center]

[line]

[center][b][u][size=+2]Usage[/size][/u][/b][/center]
[line]

[center]Can be found under Misc section of a smithing forge after completion of the Nightingale Armor quest line.[/center]

[center][list][*]Craft: Leather x2 + Leather strips x3[*]Temper: Void Salts x1[/list][/center]

[line]

[center][b][u][size=+2]Conflics[/size][/u][/b][/center]
[line]

[center]Shouldn't be any now.[/center]

[line]

[center][b][u][size=+2]Version[/size][/u][/b][/center]
[line]

[center][b]1.4[/b][/center]

[center][list][*]Changed to be its own craftable/temperable Item (See "Usage" section for requirements).[/list][/center]

[center][b]1.3[/b][/center]

[center][list][*]Changed Armature IDs to be unique to prevent conficts.[/list][/center]

[center][b]1.2[/b][/center]

[center][list][*]Changed mesh reference names to not conflict for mods that use the vanilla meshs.[/list][/center]

[center][b]1.1[/b][/center]

[center][list][*]Added support for all playable vanilla races.[*]Fixed mesh error on weight slider.[/list][/center]

[center][b]1.0[/b][/center]

[center][list][*]Initial release.[/list][/center]

[line]

[center][b][u][size=+2]Credits[/size][/u][/b][/center]
[line]

[center]AutoDesk[/center]
[center]Bethesda[/center]
[center]Figment[/center]
[center]Niftools Team[/center]
author: Lord Haun
